newsitem.title: USA: FINEX Asian futures trade off to slow start.
newsitem.headline: FINEX Asian futures trade off to slow start.

text.p: Futures contracts for the Indonesia rupiah, Thai baht and Malaysian ringgit got off to a slow start since trade began on Friday, but an exchange official said Tuesday said the volume would pick up soon.

FINEX, the financial products division of the New York Cotton Exchange, reported that the rupiah and baht each saw two contracts trade on Friday and none on Monday, whereas four ringgit contracts traded Friday and 79 on Monday.
"It's always difficult to get these contracts off the ground," said Tim Barry, an offical at FINEX, noting that the outlook was good.
"We're not that concerned about the first days' volume, we're concerned about volume down the road," Barry said.

"When we look at the emerging Asian market, we think they will be characterized by intermittent volatility, which will be extended periods when the price relationships will be fairly stable, interrupted by periods when it will not."
